resources.string: On this screen, you can freely register words that you want to appear in the keyboard predictive conversion.\nRegistered words will appear as conversion candidates on the keyboard once you type at least the number of characters specified in their "reading".

You can register email addresses, code snippets, Markdown tables, and more with short "readings". When you type the registered "reading" exactly on the keyboard, the full registered text will appear as a conversion candidate.

Examples:
- Reading: myemail
 Template: my.long.email.address@example.com
- Reading: html5
 Template: <!DOCTYPE html><html>â€¦</html>
You can add or remove keyboards
Height adjustment for certain devices is enabled (e.g., Galaxy).
Height adjustment for certain devices is disabled.
Set the maximum number of conversion candidates to display.
Number of columns for conversion candidates
Set the number of columns when displaying conversion candidates.
Please select the number of candidate columns.
Setting for the height of the View that displays conversion candidates.
Please select the height of the View that displays conversion candidates.
Don\'t show conversion candidates while typing a password
Show conversion candidates while typing a password
Treat as pre-edit text during password input.
Treat as committed text during password input.
Delete key action on highlighted candidate
Long press Delete: Unhighlight\nTap Delete: Move selection back one place
